clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of R935788 Tablets to Treat Rheumatoid Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel Dose Study of Two Doses of R935788 in Rheumatoid Arthritis Patients Failing to Respond to Methotrexate

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the Spleen Tyrosine Kinase (Syk) inhibitor, R935788 (R788), at a dose of 100 mg, orally, twice-a-day, and/or a dose of of 150 mg, orally, once-a-day is effective in the treatment of Rheumatoid Arthrits in patients who have had an inadequate clinical response to methotrexate.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: American College of Rheumatology 20 (ACR20) Response at 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with greater than or equal to 20% improvement in tender and swollen joint counts, AND in any 3 of the following: physician's assessment of disease activity, patient's assessment of disease activity, patient's assessment of pain, HAQ-DI; and C-Reactive Protein (CRP) or erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), after 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: American College of Rheumatology Index of Improvement (ACRn) at 1 Week
secondary_outcome.description: The index of improvement in RA, where 0 indicates no improvement and 100 indicates a 100% improvement across all signs and symptoms of RA after 1 week of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Activity Score-C-Reactive Protein (DAS28-CRP) <2.6 at 1 Month
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with DAS28-CRP (measuring RA symptoms including: tender joint count, swollen joint count, patient's assessment of disease activity, and CRP in patients with high CRP at baseline), of less than 2.6. The DAS runs from 0 to 10 - higher scores indicate worse symptoms. A score of less than 2.6 indicates remission of RA symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-F) at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in FACIT-F, which is a patient-reported 13-item questionnaire that assesses fatigue, calculated as the score at 6 months minus the score at baseline. The FACIT-F runs from 0 to 52 with lower scores indicating higher fatigue. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement in fatigue after treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the PCS of the SF-36 (which assesses health and wellbeing), calculated as the score at 6 months minus the score at baseline. The PCS ranges from 0 to 100 with 100 indicating the highest level of functioning possible. A positive change indicates an improvement in PCS after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) Mental Component Summary (MCS) at 6 Months
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the MCS of the SF-36 (which assesses health and wellbeing), calculated as the score at 6 months minus the score at baseline. The MCS ranges from 0 to 100 with 100 indicating the highest level of functioning possible. A positive change indicates an improvement in MCS after treatment

secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with ALT (a test of liver function) values greater than 1.5 times the ULN

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The first participant received the first dose of study drug on 19 May 2008; the last participant completed the study on 01 June 2009. Participants were recruited from centers in the United States, Europe and Latin America.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Male/female participants who had active rheumatoid arthritis (RA) for a minimum of 6 months, and receiving a weekly methotrexate (MTX) dose for a minimum of 3 months were randomly assigned to receive R788 150 mg once daily, 100 mg twice daily, placebo once daily or placebo twice daily. It was planned to randomize approximately 420 participants.

outcome.title: Disease Activity Score-C-Reactive Protein (DAS28-CRP) <2.6 at 1 Month
outcome.description: Number of participants with DAS28-CRP (measuring RA symptoms including: tender joint count, swollen joint count, patient's assessment of disease activity, and CRP in patients with high CRP at baseline), of less than 2.6. The DAS runs from 0 to 10 - higher scores indicate worse symptoms. A score of less than 2.6 indicates remission of RA symptoms
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat Population with CRP as Primary Phase Reactant with available data and received study drug.

measure.title: Disease Activity Score-Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate (DAS28-ESR) <3.2 at 1 Month
measure.description: Number of participants with DAS28-ESR (measuring RA symptoms including: tender joint count, swollen joint count, patient's assessment of disease activity, and ESR in patients with high ESR at baseline), of less than 3.2. The DAS runs from 0 to 10 - higher scores indicate worse symptoms. A score of less than 3.2 indicates low disease activity
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat Population with ESR as Primary Phase Reactant with available data and received study drug.

outcome.title: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-F) at 6 Months
outcome.description: Change from baseline in FACIT-F, which is a patient-reported 13-item questionnaire that assesses fatigue, calculated as the score at 6 months minus the score at baseline. The FACIT-F runs from 0 to 52 with lower scores indicating higher fatigue. A positive change from baseline indicates an improvement in fatigue after treatment.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population with available data and received study drug.

outcome.title: Short Form Health Survey (SF-36) Physical Component Summary (PCS) at 6 Months
outcome.description: Change from baseline in the PCS of the SF-36 (which assesses health and wellbeing), calculated as the score at 6 months minus the score at baseline. The PCS ranges from 0 to 100 with 100 indicating the highest level of functioning possible. A positive change indicates an improvement in PCS after treatment
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population with available data and received study drug.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The 2 placebo groups (bid and qd) were pooled for all efficacy data summaries and analysis since the observed ACR20 response rate difference between the placebo groups was <15 percentage points (prospectively defined in protocol).
